body_html:
@namrata-ibm The "block overrun" error can only come from Apache Commons Compress BZip2CompressorInputStream (Bazel uses v1.9). I find it very concerning that it'd happen on a valid bz2 file. Maybe @bodewig can help us? He works on Apache Commons Compress. Further context:

  • https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/repository/TarBz2Function.java
  • https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/third_party/BUILD#L120
  • bazelbuild/bazel@ed7ced0
body_text:
@namrata-ibm The "block overrun" error can only come from Apache Commons Compress BZip2CompressorInputStream (Bazel uses v1.9). I find it very concerning that it'd happen on a valid bz2 file. Maybe @bodewig can help us? He works on Apache Commons Compress. Further context:

https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/repository/TarBz2Function.java
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/third_party/BUILD#L120
bazelbuild/bazel@ed7ced0
body:
@namrata-ibm The "block overrun" error can only come from Apache Commons Compress `BZip2CompressorInputStream` (Bazel uses v1.9). I find it very concerning that it'd happen on a valid bz2 file. Maybe @bodewig can help us? He works on Apache Commons Compress. Further context:

- https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/repository/TarBz2Function.java
- https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/third_party/BUILD#L120
- https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/ed7ced0018dc5c5ebd6fc8afc7158037ac1df00d
